newsitem.title: USA: Emerald Financial sets 2-for-1 stock split.
newsitem.headline: Emerald Financial sets 2-for-1 stock split.

text.p: Emerald Financial Corp Friday announced a 2-for-1 stock split, to take effect May 15, 1997, for all shareholders of record as of May 1.
The split increases the company's outstanding shares from 2,530,800 to 5,061,600, the company said in a statement.
The company also declared a split-adjusted dividend to shareholders of record on May 23, payable on June 16, of $0.06 per share.
Emerald Financial Corp, a unitary thrift holding company, is the parent company of the Strongsville Savings Bank, an Ohio-chartered, federally insured savings association with 14 offices and 11 ATMs.
